name: badass-jlink-plugin-2.10.0
body:
This release adds support for target-platform-specific module paths, which is especially useful for creating runtime images of JavaFX applications for different platforms.
See the new `targetPlatform` method in [the documentation](https://badass-jlink-plugin.beryx.org/releases/latest/#_methods) and have a look at the [badass-jlink-example-javafx-multiproject](https://github.com/beryx-gist/badass-jlink-example-javafx-multiproject). See how its build script [uses this new feature](https://github.com/beryx-gist/badass-jlink-example-javafx-multiproject/blob/2a8374dd6cc4224ff278a4fb7bbd526323ae7e63/gui/build.gradle#L19-L26) to allow Travis to create [runtime images for Mac, Linux and Windows](https://github.com/beryx-gist/badass-jlink-example-javafx-multiproject/tree/images).

name: badass-jlink-plugin-2.8.0
body:
- jpackage: pass jvmArgs as multiple --jvm-args arguments (thanks to @lenborje)
- jpackage: use the image built by the jlink task as argument of the --runtime-image option (thanks to @lenborje)
- jpackage: use the new property `targetPlatformName` to specify which of the images built by jlink is passed as argument of the --runtime-image option

name: badass-jlink-plugin-2.7.0

- MacOS fixes (thanks to @lenborje)
- adjustments for compatibility with jpackage build 30 (thanks to @lenborje)
- do not change the CWD in the Unix template (thanks to @lenborje)
- add support for local dependencies (issue #33)
- add BOM support (issue #36)

name: badass-jlink-plugin-2.6.6
body:
- Use a wider split pattern in getFallbackModuleName in order to get rid of 'version numbers' embedded in the module name
- Use null in execute() to get inherited environment instead of empty

Thanks to @lenborje for these fixes!

name: badass-jlink-plugin-2.3.0
body:
- added the convenience property `imageName`, which allows setting the values of both `imageDir` and `imageZip`.
- fixed an issue causing the _"too many open files"_ failure.
- there is no longer a `-gradle4` flavor of the plugin. Both Gradle 5+ and Gradle 4.8+ are supported by the same version.

name: badass-jlink-plugin-2.2.1
body:
Fixes issue #15 by using the following strategy to set the default value of the `javaHome` property:

- if present, use the value of the `badass.jlink.java.home` system property
- if present, use the value of the `BADASS_JLINK_JAVA_HOME` environment variable
- if the `java.home` system property points to a JRE that contains `javac`, `jar`, and `jlink`, use its value
- otherwise, use the value of the `JAVA_HOME` environment variable

name: badass-jlink-plugin-2.2.0
body:
- enhancement (issue #15): set the default value of the `javaHome`property with the first non-empty value from:
     - the badass.jlink.java.home system property
     - the BADASS_JLINK_JAVA_HOME environment variable
     - the JAVA_HOME environment variable

- fix issue #16

name: badass-jlink-plugin-1.1.0
body:
New extension properties:
- imageZip: the zip file containing the custom runtime image
- beforeZip: closure wth actions to be performed after excuting jlink and before creating the imageZip
